p: Staphylococcus and Streptococcus bacteria alter the centesimal composition, somatic cell number (somatic cell counts), and the microbiological, physical, and chemical qualities of milk [ 4]. Staphylococcus spp. is mainly found in milk samples from animals with clinical mastitis (CM) [ 5] while Staphylococcus coagulase-negative (SCNs) are frequently isolated in bovine milk and are considered similar to secondary pathogens [ 6] that promote the inflammation of the mammary gland [ 7].
